an2.31:1: "Bhikkhus, these two things pertain to true knowledge.[n.249]Vijjābhāgiyā. SeeAN.575.What two? Serenity and insight. When serenity is developed, what benefit does one experience? The mind is developed. When the mind is developed, what benefit does one experience? Lust is abandoned. When insight is developed, what benefit does one experience? Wisdom is developed. When wisdom is developed, what benefit does one experience? Ignorance is abandoned.[n.250] For more on the relationship of serenity(samatha)and insight(vipassanā), seeAN4.92–94 andAN4.70.
